c74object.name: 264.sfrecord~
c74object.digest: Record soundfiles to disk via a graphical interface.
c74object.description: Easily record mono soundfiles and save them to disk in a simple graphical interface.

inlet.description: Audio input that will be recorded to disk.
Sets the volume of the input audio. Floats are understood as absolute values in dB (-70.–12.). Integers are understood as a MIDI range (0–127) and mapped logarithmically to the float range.

Sets the name your file will be saved to. Audio extensions (e.g. .wav) will be stripped. Any non-alphanumeric character will be replaced by a hyphen, e.g. an input of ±!@A£$%^*()_+ will be saved as ---A-------_-. All audio files are saved to your soundfiles folder.

c74object.discussion: Used in a bpatcher, 264.sfrecord~ provides a graphical interface to easily record a mono soundfile to your hard drive. 264.sfrecord~ saves files to your patch’s soundfiles folder, allowing for easy use later with 264.sfplay~. Connect to your MIDI controller by clicking on the 264.midi-learn arrows.
